Dashain: The biggest and most important festival in Nepal, celebrated in September or October for 15 days.

Tihar: Also known as the festival of lights, it is celebrated in October or November for five days. 
 Holi: A spring festival, also known as the festival of colors, celebrated in March. 
 Teej: A womenâ€™s festival celebrated in August or September, marked by fasting and dancing. 
 Shivaratri: A festival dedicated to Lord Shiva, celebrated in February or March. 
 Buddha Jayanti: A festival celebrated to commemorate the birth, enlightenment, and death of Lord Buddha, celebrated in April or May. 
 Gai Jatra: A festival celebrated to honor the dead, celebrated in August or September. 
 Indra Jatra: A festival celebrated in September, marked by the display of the Kumari, the living goddess. 
 Maghe Sankranti: A festival celebrated in January, marking the end of the winter solstice. 
 Chhath: A festival celebrated in November, mainly in the Terai region, dedicated to the worship of the sun god.
